episodes.summary: Fanny Howe talks to us about the range of Jean Valentine’s poems.

episodes.title: What If It Doesn't Make Sense?
episodes.summary: Matthew Zapruder parses a John Ashbery poem.

episodes.summary: Al Filreis brings Dial-a-Poem back to life at Kelly Writers House in Philadelphia.

episodes.title: The Hebrew Bible Has No Soul
episodes.summary: Robert Alter on his radical reworking of the book of Psalms

episodes.title: Manifesto You
episodes.summary: Mary Anne Caws talks the whys and wherefores of manifestos by Charles Bernstein, A.E. Stallings, and Thomas Sayers Ellis that first appeared in Poetry magazine.

episodes.title: More Than Meets the I
episodes.summary: Rae Armantrout gets personal without the pronoun.

episodes.title: When the Weary Blues Met Jazz
episodes.summary: Langston Hughes's collaboration with Charles Mingus and Leonard Feather.

episodes.title: The Poet and the Saint
episodes.summary: The untold story of Czeslaw Milosz's rancor toward a Holocaust hero.

episodes.title: People Don't Read This Way Anymore
episodes.summary: Ernest Hilbert and Curtis Fox discuss the late, great W.D. Snodgrass's formalism, dark humor, and passionate reading style.

episodes.title: Remembering Denmark's Greatest Poet
episodes.summary: On the occasion of Inger Christensen's death, Naja Marie Aidt and Pejk Malinovski read and discuss her work.

episodes.title: Inaugural Poetics
episodes.summary: Hear who Elizabeth Alexander would have picked and her thoughts on Frost and other past inaugural poets.

episodes.summary: Elizabeth Alexander on how the Derek Walcott-toting, June Jordan-quoting president will affect poets and poetry.

episodes.summary: The editors of Poetry magazine recommend their favorite books from this year.

episodes.title: DIY Poetry Movements
episodes.summary: How Zukofsky and the language poets got started, and the rules for starting a movement of your own.

episodes.title: Poems for President Obama
episodes.summary: Charles Bernstein, Patricia Smith and Forrest Gander offer presidential advice.

episodes.title: What's So Funny About Sex and Death?
episodes.summary: Albert Goldbarth shows why he won the Mark Twain Award for Humor in Poetry.

episodes.title: The Child is Mother to the Poet
episodes.summary: Hear Children's Poet Laureate Mary Ann Hoberman on her trade secret: total recall of childhood.

episodes.title: The Mama and the Papa
episodes.summary: Hear Gwendolyn Brooks read "the mother" and Theodore Roethke read "My Papa's Waltz," with insights by ex-US Poet Laureate Donald Hall.

episodes.title: Poem Before the Event
episodes.summary: A pair of poems about September 11th, written before the planes were even in the air.

episodes.title: Battle of the Bards
episodes.summary: Hear Denise Levertov's scathing Vietnam poem "Life at War," and find out why it made her friend Robert Duncan declare war on her.

episodes.summary: How Seamus Heaney defines Ireland's 1972 troubles with a portrait of a drunken seaman blown up in a pub.

episodes.summary: Was he really the best Chinese poet of his time?

episodes.title: Seven Essential Dreams Revisited
episodes.summary: Steve Almond recalls his beret-wearing days as a poet, and why it's a good thing he turned to prose.

episodes.title: Was Whitman Really Gay?
episodes.summary: A bar fight in the East Village settles it.

episodes.title: Just a Bunch of Consciousnesses, and a Bunch of Stuff
episodes.summary: The late A.R. Ammons and the immutable laws of nature, featuring a recording from the 92nd St. Y.

episodes.summary: W.S. Di Piero discusses Browning's "Fra Lippo Lippi," with a reading of the poem by Paul Giamatti.

episodes.summary: Translator Michael Hofmann in conversation about Bertolt Brecht's poem, "Of Poor B.B.," read here by Tony Award nominee Michael Stuhlbarg.

episodes.summary: Jane Hirshfield reads her poems "Heat" and "Autumn Heat."

episodes.summary: A reading of "One Afternoon," by Joanie Mackowski.

episodes.summary: Three very short poems, by John Updike, Emperor Hadrian and an anonymous erotic Sanskrit poem.

episodes.summary: A portrait of poet Samuel Menashe, produced by Emily Botein.

episodes.summary: Charlotte Maier reads "Consolation," by Wislawa Szymborska, and a conversation with her translator Clare Cavanagh.

episodes.summary: Acclaimed poet Donald Hall reads and talks about two of his poems, "White Apples," and "The Man in the Dead Machine."

episodes.title: Poetry Goes Hollywood
episodes.summary: Two readings by Tony-nominated actor Alfred Molina: a reading of Robert Browning's "My Last Duchess" and "A Pedestrian" by Amit Majmudar.
